visuals.title: 10 PRINT: Image Dithering
visuals.description:
This sketch creates a 10PRINT-dithered image of Casey Reas, creator of Processing and author of the book "10 PRINT CHR$(205.5+RND(1)); : GOTO 10"

The randomness used to create the labyrinth pattern is taken from the image source.
 
Move the mouse left for maximum randomness
(sampling the least significant bits)

Move the mouse right for minimum randomness
(sampling the most significant bits)
 
Press any key to switch between resolutions.

visuals.title: Glitch Effect
visuals.description:
A simple glitch effect that I applied to an image made in Apophysis 7x.

===== Instructions =====

Wait a few seconds for it to load.

Press Control to generate a new image (you might have to click the canvas for key presses to get detected).

Press and hold the mouse button to show the original image.

Press Space to save a snapshot of the current image.
visuals.instructions:
Wait a few seconds for it to load.

Press Control to generate a new image (you might have to click the canvas for key presses to get detected).

Press and hold the mouse button to show the original image.

Press Space to save a snapshot of the current image (doesn't include the preview in the top-left corner).

visuals.title: Pixel to time
visuals.description:
The program scans an image in order to check each of its pixel's value. Pixels of the screen can be randomly either white or black, but the darker a pixel value of the image is, the more often it will be displayed in black on the screen.

french : ce programme scanne une image pour vérifier la luminosité de chacun de ses pixels. À l'écran, chaque pixel peut être affiché en noir ou en blanc selon un hasard qui est conditionné à la luminosité de l'image de départ. Donc un point noir de l'image aura x fois plus de chances d'être affiché en noir qu'un point blanc.

visuals.title: Noise flow field painter
visuals.description:
*It may need a moment to load*

Paints an image with strokes that are rotated by a flow field driven from noise.

If you want to try it on your own image you need to drag and drop an image in the sketch's files tab. Then add your image's file name to the variable imgNames (it's near the top). It doesn't capture details very well so close ups work best.

Controls:
  - Click to change to the next image.
  - Press any key to save the canvas to a jpg.
visuals.instructions: Click for the next image, press a key to save a jpg.

visuals.title: Beat_the_Rainbow
visuals.description:
twitter : https://twitter.com/mizzsig

I was shocked to difference in java mode and javascript mode at Processing's noise() function.

Value in noise() function is too big to javascript mode.
But it's good to java mode.

----------------------------------------------------------

Processingのjavaモードとjavascriptモードではnoise()関数の挙動が違ってくるみたいですね。

javaモードで作ってた時はnoise()関数の引数が大きくても小さくてもそれなりに動いてたのですが、javascriptモードのときは引数を小さくしないとノイズが発生しませんでした。

visuals.title: Dancing Polygons-modified
visuals.description:
Polygons with equal number of sides and contracting radiuses, rotating and translating along the center, synchronizing  at regular phase intervals to give an illusion of dancing geometric identities.

modify some names to let reader know the meaning of each value.
And add some comments that I think is necessary.
visuals.instructions:
•	Press 's' to save.
•	Press SPACE BAR to play/pause.
•	Right click mouse to increment sides by one and change colour.
•	Left click mouse to decrement sides by one and change colour.
•	Press Scroll button to change only the colour.

All I did was tweak the formula to take into account the relative velocity between particles.

visuals.description: Number : Number of Mover. Attraction : Power of attraction. InitVel : Initial velocity of Mover.

visuals.title: Blue Mountains
visuals.description:
A mountain range landscape.

Inspired by lesson 38 of Fun Programming: http://funprogramming.org/38-Animate-the-ocean-surface-using-noise.html 

Colors chosen to work on Javascript (the clouds and the sky gradient look different on Java mode). Also, I don't know why, the lerpColor didn't work on Java, it's possible to get the same effect with separated map functions for hue, saturation and brightness though.
visuals.instructions:
Mouse click to generate a new pattern.
Press s to save as an image.

visuals.title: Camera motion to MSA
visuals.description:
-Detect motion/flow from webcam and plug it unto MSA fluid, 
-Renders it back mirrored. 
-Awesome.
-Webkit browsers only.
-Requires a decent machine!
-Will not compile or run in PDE! (due to the way the webcam code works)

Check my profile for a high resolution version! (it's a tweak of this one)
visuals.instructions: Open in a Webkit browser like Chrome / Safari. Turn your webcam on. Wave your hand, turn your head

visuals.title: ml5 YOLO Example
visuals.description: Hold a cell phone or everyday object to your camera
visuals.instructions: Hold a cell phone or everyday object to your camera

visuals.title: Fractals from Chaos
visuals.description: 8 points in chaos game (with specific rules such that you cannot pick the same point again)
visuals.instructions:
keyboard:
a/s: increase and decrease the number of points
z/x:  the division factor. Half way, or third the way
the space bar (boolean) can the point choose the same point
'k': (boolean) keep drawing or not

visuals.title: Reaction Diffusion - Webgl2
visuals.description:
Webgl2 Multipass-Rendering using custom shaders and my lightweight WebGl1+2 wrapper (dwgl.js).

https://github.com/diwi/p5.EasyCam

The Reaction Diffusion sketch is a port of the PixelFlow library for Processing.

Requires a browser that supports Webgl1 or Webgl2 and some extensions.

visuals.title: dance Signature
visuals.description:
Digital Signature created by the transformation path of two randomly generated beziere curves. The text you see at the bottom of the sketch is the seed value for the random generator. Change the seed and see what happens.

Controls:
- TYPE SOMETHING = create seed
- MOUSECLICK = create random seed and generate signature
- BACKSPACE/DEL = delete last letter
- RETURN/ENTER/CTRL = confirm your seed and generate signature
- ALT = save image

visuals.title: circular dance colour version
visuals.description: 3 lines following three points rotating an three circles

visuals.title: expressivedance001
visuals.description: Controls: Mouse pressed stops the lines from spiraling inward, and stops showing their paths. Mouse not pressed sends the lines spiraling inward. At first let the mouse hold still in the center for a few seconds, then start. Also try holding down the mouse and moving it around the screen a bit, and then releasing the mouse and hold it perfectly still, watching what happens. The code is relatively easy to figure out, it's a particle system. Enjoy.

visuals.description: Click & drag anywhere

I did NOT develop delaunay.js, and not sure who the author really is to give proper credit.
visuals.instructions: Drag the mouse, press any key to toggle between fill and stroke.

visuals.title: Wobbly Swarm
visuals.description:
Each particle interacts with every other particle.
When they are too close, they repel.
When they are too far, they attract.
Notice the surface tension!
visuals.instructions: Click, drag or caress the mouse.

visuals.title: Mic in
visuals.description: Another vizualization sketch, based on the excellent work of Inigo Quilez (ShaderToy)
visuals.instructions: Click, listen and watch... Sorry, you may have to wait for the sound file to load...

visuals.title: Microphone to Piano
visuals.instructions: Wait for MIC noise calibration, then sing and then listen your melody

visuals.title: Typehover
visuals.description: The FitnessGram Pacer Test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively gets more difficult as it continues. The 20 meter pacer test will begin in 30 seconds. Line up at the start. The running speed starts slowly but gets faster each minute after you hear this signal bodeboop. A sing lap should be completed every time you hear this sound. ding Remember to run in a straight line and run as long as possible. The second time you fail to complete a lap before the sound, your test is over. The test will begin on the word start. On your mark. Get ready!… Start.

visuals.title: Process4.reload()
visuals.description: A take on Process 4 by Casey Reas

Lots of particles that start off on the edge of a word moving according to a perlin noise flow field.

visuals.instructions: Tap or draw a line to deposit extra particles

visuals.title: Galaxy circus

Steps around 360 degrees each point and adds sin/cos/noise to get its motion.

Try playing around with the settings to get whole different effects.
visuals.instructions: Use the on-screen controls to interact with the sim.

visuals.title: Velocity driven
visuals.description: Color and size are driven by the object's velocity.
visuals.instructions: Move the mouse around to interact with the objects

A Fork of Raven's awesome sketch.

Changed how it renders to feel more stylized.
visuals.instructions: Drag the mouse to spawn, press any key to change hue.

visuals.title: painter
visuals.instructions: Mouse click to switch to the next image.

visuals.title: Art gallery painter
visuals.description:
Maps the image's brightness to determine the stroke's direction and the color's hue.

Mouse click to switch to the next image.

You can try your own image by editing the variable imgNames and the preload on line 1. Images that don't exceed 700px work best. It doesn't capture details well so close ups also work best.
visuals.instructions: Mouse click to switch to the next image.

visuals.title: Vote!
visuals.description:
Pick the ultimate choice!

Vote by typing in your choice in the comments then refresh the page (not just the sketch) to see yourself!

And no, you can't spam your vote!
visuals.instructions: Vote by typing in the comments. Interact with the mouse.

visuals.title: Waterfall cascades
visuals.description: Simulation of water colliding against rocks, and splitting to smaller drops.
visuals.instructions: Use the sliders to interact with the sim.

visuals.title: Wisps
visuals.description:
Each wisp records its position to create its long streak.
They try to follow the mouse and settle at its position.

Controls:
	- Move the mouse to lead the particles.

visuals.title: Radio waves
visuals.description: Arcs are used to get this wave-like pattern.

visuals.title: Flow field waterfall
visuals.description: Particles are driven by a flow field until it reaches the yellow line. Then their dynamics are enabled and take over to make them fall. Inspired by Robert D'arcy's sketch Surfs up (www.openprocessing.org/sketch/298646) Controls: - Click to change to the next flow preset. - Move mouse along the width to set where gravity takes over.

visuals.title: Oil-water phase separation
visuals.description:
A 2D model of how oil and water molecules repel each other with different strengths, making them self-assemble into groups. Based on the PhD thesis of Naoaki Ono.

The mouse controls a water molecule so you can push the oil blobs around.

If you want to play it as a game, try this:

Task 1: push all the blobs together into one big blob.

Task 2: split the big blob into little blobs. You get more points for the more separate blobs you make.

(Note: there aren't any points, you will have to make up your own scoring system.)
visuals.instructions: Move the mouse to push the oil blobs around

visuals.title: Sunset Waves
visuals.description: Sunset seascape using sine waves

visuals.title: Futurist Labyrinth
visuals.description:
A Depth-First Search labyrinth on a triangular grid making a brain like geometry.

Inspired by Dan Shiffman's videos: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HyK_Q5rrcr4

p5.js version: http://p5ide.herokuapp.com/view/57291ea42a140703008e76d9

Mouse click to restart drawing.

visuals.title: EXP012 Separation
visuals.description:
Experimatic day 12

visuals.title: Rorschach Generator
visuals.description:
To see how this works, hit 'f' to disable the filter. You'll see that the balls are darkest at the center and lightest at the outside. The filter gets rid of everything lighter than the threshold, and turns everything else black. 


controls:
Various modes of motion: 1-7
Reset everything: z
Toggle Rorschach mode: r
Cycle through shapes: s
Invert shape: i
Invert colors toggle: b
Random/BW color switch: c
Pause motion: p
Filter toggle: f
Discrete/Continuous: d

Change number of balls: _,+
Change radius: -,=
Change discretization steps: {,}
Adjust threshold: [,]

visuals.title: Van Gogh Belandi
visuals.description: (minor tweak of original) ; Relies more on noise than on luminance to determine stroke angle,  and bases the stroke angle around the lower center of the painting (as if painted with an elbow from there). feels more van-gogh-ish to me.
visuals.instructions: Just watch. Click to clear and start again.

visuals.description: 歪む文字を''sleeeepy''から''distortion(歪み)''に変更し、歪みの速度を遅くした。

visuals.title: Differential Growth
visuals.description: Just a classic basic differential growth algo. Nothing crazy

visuals.title: Awesome Tree
visuals.description:
Since everybody got one: Here is my version of a recursive Tree. The text you see at the bottom of the sketch is the seed value for the random generator. Change the seed and see what happens.

Controls:
- TYPE SOMETHING = create seed
- MOUSECLICK = create random seed and generate tree
- BACKSPACE/DEL = delete last letter
- RETURN/ENTER/CTRL = confirm your seed and generate tree
- ALT = save image

comments.text: the method blend is not applicable for the arguments

I recode the code to achieve the same effect by the skill I'v learned. But it can be run in Processing in computer not on this website.

New to this program.  I also get errors in the blend arguments.  Any help on how to resolve this?
